text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with goat cheese apple walnut pasta
so anyway this was supposed to be a
delicious winter pasta entree which did
not work at all but it did work as a
super side dish so anyway more about
that later let me show you how i put
this together so I have a couple cups of
macaroni here I'm using Dietl Eenie you
could use any small pasta I have some
fresh thyme one apple I'm using a pink
lady I believe some creamy goat cheese
and walnuts alright for the apples of
course I took the core out you could and
maybe should peel these I decided to
leave the peel on I was thinking it
would look a little more interesting and
you know add some nutritional value and
you know it a big stickler I am for
nutrition alright so once our apples are
diced we're going to take those over to
the stove and saute those in a little
bit of butter like a tablespoon of
butter we're going to saute those over
medium heat just for a couple minutes
alright these are going to kind of
soften in the broth but I do want to
give them a couple minutes head start
you should see the edges just starting
to get a little bit golden at that point
I'm going to add a cup of chicken broth
and yes I suppose you could use
vegetable broth if you're you know
prejudiced against chickens alright
we're going to turn the heat up to
medium-high we're going to bring that up
to a simmer and we're going to simmer
that for just two minutes that's it just
two minutes and then turn it down to low
okay and just leave it like that so the
base to our sauce is ready now it's time
to cook our macaroni like I said I'm
using Dietl Eenie of course you're going
to use salted water and you know I'm
always stressing that because pasta cook
and unsalted water is bland alright so
you're gonna cook that according to
directions and while that's cooking we
will finish our sauce so our Heat's on
as low as it will go I'm going to take
my goat cheese a couple tablespoons at a
time and simply stir it into this hot
broth so the temperature is very
important here again the heat has to be
on as low as it goes we don't want this
simmering or boiling that will cause the
cheese possibly to separate so like I
said you're going to do a couple
tablespoons at a time and it should just
melt in there beautifully in form after
three or four additions a beautiful
thick creamy goat cheese and
applesauce so cream sauces are very
popular for pastas of course but they're
usually either a bechamel based or heavy
cream based sauce so this is just a
third way to do a cream sauce using a
broth for something a little lighter all
right so our sauce is basically done I'm
going to turn off the heat by now our
pasta is cooked we're going to drain
that but not super super thoroughly all
right I don't want standing water at the
bottom of the pot but a little bit of
moisture on that pasta is perfect
and will help transfer this sauce around
so I'm going to dump our goat cheese
sauce in we're going to mix it up stir
it up and you'll see because there was a
little bit of water attached to the
pasta it really mixes in nicely
all right that's why Italians a lot of
times reserve some of the pasta water
and if it seems a little dry you could
add another spoon in but anyway ours is
looking perfect just like that we're
gonna season this up with some black
pepper a good dose some salt of course
some cayenne pepper you know he things
up a little bit and then some fresh
minced thyme a really really nice
combination with the goat cheese in the
Apple and last but not least about a
half cup of chopped toasted walnuts and
that pasta is done of course you're
going to give it one final taste but you
know that and I don't even have to tell
you that I just do you know they make
conversation all right so I spoon that
up into a bowl I thought I was going to
have myself a beautiful beautiful winter
pasta dinner
you got that tangy goat cheese perfect
with that sweet apple the herbaceous
time the earthy crunch of the walnut
just a really great combination of
flavors but this does not make a great
entree all right after eight about half
a bowl I didn't want anymore
all right it just stopped being
interesting so instead of deeming this a
failure for a pasta dinner I decided it
was a smashing success as a side dish
then it was perfect with some roast pork
roast pork not included sold separately
so anyway like I said it was a really
nice combination and I really hope you
give it a try but probably best as a
side dish not necessarily as a giant
plate for an entree oh and by the way
you don't like goat cheese and you want
to know if you could do this with
something else no you can't make
a different recipe anyway head over to
food wishes calm for all the ingredient
amounts as usual and as always enjoy
